data.text: @KrudeOne Ay, I appreciate you responding to my rant though. 🤗

@KrudeOne Yes, but that was never the narrative. Ever. They used the obvious to paint a much more sinister picture than the one you just stated. And those rising cases were used to push the vaccine without any context at all. Context has been missing for 2 years.
@KrudeOne Why do we only apply logic when people go against the narrative? But when it comes to the actual narrative the logic isn't logic, it's just fear. I don't understand the inconsistency.

@KrudeOne Where was this logic when they were using positive covid results to drive hysteria and the vaccine when the rise in cases were due to way more people being tested? And where was this logic when most of the deaths were being conflated with and blamer on covid when it wasn't covid?

@KrudeOne I've been trying to apply that kind of logic during the whole pandemic but it was never the applied logic. That data says the vaccine is killing people. Which is the opposite of what it was meant to do. Are you saying that the vaccine isn't the issue?

@OfficialSkribz The footnotes explain that because the majority of people are vaxxed, they will also constitute the most deaths despite the percentage of people dying of covid with the vaccine being much much lower.
@OfficialSkribz The footnotes explain it pretty well
